item.description:
Translated from the manual

Tiro Finale is a card game based on Mami's and the Cake Witch's battle in Puella Magi Madoka Magica

The game consists of 2 types of cards, Mami cards representing Mami's power and Witch cards representing the Cake Witch. All cards have a power of 1 to 6.

The game is about being the first to claim that the total of Mami's power (both the open information on the table and the hidden information in each player's hand) is bigger than that of the Witch.

In the survival action card game Card of the Dead, players are trapped in a town full of zombies; engulfed in the scourge of terror, they must try to survive the zombie horde. Some will frantically seek to flee the city, others will seek to barricade themselves in buildings against the terrible siege. By not getting surrounded, and through the use of both luck and brains(!), you will be able to survive the night.

In game terms, from a deck of cards containing zombies, items and events, players are dealt a hand of cards. Each turn, players draw a card. If the card's a zombie, the player places it in front of himself; if not, he adds the card to his hand and plays one card of his choice. Certain items give the player a chance to flee. The player who first lays down a predetermined number of escape cards – or who is simply the last one alive – wins the game.

item.description:
Translated from the manual

All players have spent six depressing years in junior high and high school. The only somewhat colourful memories from those years are the memories together with their childhood friend and the class' top student, Shizuka Miyamoto.

On the graduation day, Shizuka left with the words "I'd liked to have really fallen in love with someone", and a couple of months later, the players are devastated as they hear she has married some guy her parents introduced.

Soon thereafter, the players see an advert recruiting people wanting to participate in a "time-space jump experiment. Only for people with strong minds."

The players participate in the experiment, and use the time machine to try to improve their past. The time machine is powered by strength of mind. The unhappier past, the stronger mind, so at the start, players are able to go back all six years. But as they change the past and get happier, their mind weakens.

Who of the players will be able to catch the heart of Shizuka Miyamoto?

Translated from the manual

This is a party card game where the players become 765 producers, trying to send out their idols to different jobs, getting as many jobs as possibel done.

There is no real difference between the different idols, but you can have fun appointing the jobs you wish for your favourite idols.

Based on the video game The Idol m@ster.

User summary

Players represent teams of cats trying to get ahold of the treats being delivered. Treat cards are lined up, with numbers on them, showing which cat(s), in queue order, will get the treat. Players play cat cards with different numbers of cats on them, face down, onto the treat cards. Once all cat cards have been played, the cat cards for each treat are turned face up and points are dealt to the player(s) who have "their" cat in the right position. "Cat Kick" cards will kick away the cat card in front of them.

A half quick game of bluffing and guessing.

User summary

Game consists of 60 cards numbered –3 to +5; all are dealt to the players. Each round, players choose 1–3 cards to put forward face down. They're revealed simultaneously, and the player who have played highest gets the trick. However, the trick is worth the total of all cards, and since there are certain cards that multiply or reverse the value (turn + into -), it's a matter of reading your opponents.

(English "block man") Swedish children's game. Wooden blocks lay face down on the table. In a Memory like fashion players take turns finding the right blocks to build a complete figure. Starting with shoes, then legs and so forth. Several leg or torso pieces can be stacked creating a funny looking final figure.

Supposed to train memory and hand/eye coordination

Objective: score most winning points by guessing the requested
term (out of creatures, plants, minerals)
 - acting by turns -
determine time or no. of winning points game ends with;
one player acts as game master: a card is drawn (randomly);
player is challenged to guess the term =>
A the faster the better the score &
B the lesser questions the better the score
remarks:
published mid/late 1960's

The cards are evenly distributed. Each child puts his cards face down in front of him. Now, in turn, clockwise, the top card of the pile is turned face-down. As soon as two matching cards are on the table: who calls the first flip, wins the pile of his opponent. But beware cards not indetical may look same at first sight.
Last player in game is the winner.

A french version of a adaptation of Risk. It revolves around the Mediterranean Basin. You collect armies by controlling territories and land sections.
Battle system revolves around throwing a higher die for the armies involved.
To win, eliminate your opponents.

Shuffle the deck and each player places his cards face down on a pile. The player with the shortest name begins and open his top card. Then the next player open his top card etc.
Different things may happen by opening cards:
1) Someone turns a card already opened by any opponent.
Player who calls "Flip" first gets both card and places them bottom of his deck.
If "Flip" is called wrongly, the penalty is discarding one of his card to flip-pot deck.
2) Card shows dice. Player rolls it and the dice shows action to player must do:
Change the direction, take the flip-pot, take all open cards from table, exchange Your discard pile with chosen opponent's discard pile etc.

Game lasts to pre-agreed time-limit. Winner is the player with the most cards.

Le fleau des dieux is based on a French comics translated in English in 2008 by Marvel ("Scourge of the Gods"). The theme of this game is a mix of both Space conquest and a the ancient Roman empire.

The game sets the players into conflict for the control of the galaxy. The victory is achieved if a player control a chain of five planets or seven in total (without the chain condition). The first phase consist of dividing the planets among all players, then you will fight to gain more.

At the beginning of his turn player should choose one of his planet, other player can do the same to participate in the fight.

The combat system is based on two type of cards :

 units (with attack values depending on the field)
 special cards




The winner will choose two planets participating to the fight and then each other player will choose one (except the last who will get nothing).

FreshBiz is a game that fundamentally changes the way its participants play their business and life by simulating and then practicing new, creative methods of entrepreneurial thinking, and problem solving to achieve their most vital goals.

Through its game-based learning, participants travel through the game on a mission to win, while gaining skills, understandings and strategies that not only help them to achieve the goals in the game, but also to excel in their lives.

Utilizing common business practices, and years of insight from entrepreneurs, FreshBiz uses tools such as the buying & selling of businesses, leveraging, negotiations, loans, business opportunities and more to simulate a business environment. Simultaneously, relationships are being forged and the atmosphere of the room buzzes as participants engage with themselves and others in entrepreneurial, multi-dimensional thinking.

Insights gained during a 60 to 90-minute game last far into the future, as our participants claim that the game impacts them for the rest of their lives. There is a distinction between change and transformation. Working harder, doing something less, spending more time else, etc are change, while transformation through FreshBiz is what shifts your paradigm completely and offers you the opportunity to play business, relationships, and life in a whole new way.

As you play FreshBiz, your goal is to reach the "Winner" lot in 90 minutes. In order to achieve your objective, as you pass from section to section (paying tolls to pass), you will have to handle different business dimensions and practice entrepreneurial skills.

The Businesses
In order to pay tolls as you cross through the board on the way to the Island, you will need to earn money. One of the many ways to do that is by starting businesses. Each player gets different businesses cards and each business card has an establishment cost and a profit. You will have to be creative and smart in handling your budget, cash flow, and strategy in order to turn your original capital into the profits you need to move ahead in the game.

Action Cards

Just as in life, each player starts the game with their own unique set of Action Cards. Essentially, these are your gifts, talents and special abilities in the game. It's up to you to use them in the best way possible, and they can be played during any turn. So, be creative and you will make money and friends The Stock Market, Loans, & Partnerships As you go through the game, there will be many business dimensions that you can leverage to help you win, such as the Stock Market, Loans, Partnerships and more...
The more dimensions you master the better results you will get and the more fun you will have...in FreshBiz and in life! So go win!

In Bee Alert, a.k.a. Honigbienchen, six colored plastic bees are hidden below six beehives with players initially knowing which bees are where.

On a turn, the active player draws a card. If it's a hive card, she takes a hive from the middle without lifting it up; if it's a bear card, she returns one hive to the middle of the table; if it's a bee card, she lifts one hive to reveal the bee. If the bee matches the color on the card, she moves the hive towards herself.

The first player with four hives wins! Alternatively, when the cards run out, whoever has the most hives in front of her wins.

item.description:
The road ahead beckons, and you want to run the course from start to finish as quickly as possible before you run out of gas. But looking ahead, some of those curves are a little steep. Perhaps it is best not to drive too fast.

Each turn you play one card from your hand, adjust your speed accordingly, and move over the appropriate number of road sections. Taking a curve too fast or a jump too slow results in damage which is paid by discarding player cards. If you cross the finish line card, you win. If you run out of cards or are unable to take enough damage, you lose.

Created for the 2012 Solitaire Print and Play Contest

Contents: 1 playing board, 4 Wood Pawns, 13 Question Cards (Ellsworth's letters), 1 spinner

Number of Players: 2, 3 or 4

Before the game starts:
1. The card portion of the platform should be broken up into 13 individual cards which are called the "LETTERS". The LETTERS are then placed, FACE UP, in a POOL next to the playing board, in easy reach of all players.
2. Each player then selects a wood pawn and places it on the space marked "START" in the center of playing board
3. Each player now spins the arrow of the spinner - the one with the highest number starts. In case of tie, player spins again.
4. Play passes to the left

Object of the game:
The player who is FIRST to enter Ellsworth's House with the most LETTERS, is the WINNER.

Special Feature of the Game:
This game consists of two parts - the first from START to the GATE - the second from the GATE to ELLSWORTH's HOUSE, including the HOME PATH and BONUS SPACE

The Play:
1. In the first part of the game (area from START to GATE) the first player spins and moves his pawn the number of spaces in any direction he chooses (either forward of backward). Player can never split his move and must always move on his turn according to the number he spins.
2. Any number of players may rest on the same space at the same time.
3. Whenever a player, in the first part of the game, lands on a color space by EXACT COUNT, he picks up the LETTER with the matching color stamp from the POOL. He must read aloud the question on that letter and the three different answers given below it. He then must state aloud which ANSWER he thinks is right, A, B or C. Each question on the LETTERS is numbered and the ANSWER CHART here in the box cover lists these numbers with their correct answers - A, B or C. If he has answered correctly, he gets a bonus move of 10 additional spaces. If his answer is incorrect, he remains on that color space until his next turn. In either case, he keeps the LETTER.
4. Each player has to place the LETTERS he picks, FACE UP in front of him, so that all players around the board can see them.
5. As long as there are LETTERS left in the POOL, NO player can enter the second part of the game. After the last LETTER has been picked up from the POOL, all players place their respective pawns on the space marked GATE and all start from there equally on the second part of the game.
6. From the GATE to the Beginning of the HOME PATH, players move only in a forward direction.
7. Whenever a player in the second part of the game lands by EXACT COUNT on a color space, he has this choice - he may take the matching color LETTER from the player who has it, or, he may advance 10 spaces.
8. The section of the pathway from the last color space to Ellsworth's House, is the HOME PATH. Once a player advances into the HOME PATH, he moves within it, forward or backward as he chooses. When a player lands by EXACT COUNT on the BONUS SPACE, he may take from any other player any LETTER he desires, regardless of the color stamp.
9. Since a plyer cannot win, unless he enters ELLSWORTH'S HOUSE with the most LETTERS, he will move back and forth within the HOME PATH until hes has more letters than the other players. As LETTERS can be taken away in the HOME PATH, there is great excitement and suspense. Until the last moment of the game, nobody knows who will safely enter ELLSWORTH'S HOUSE.
10. To enter ELLSWORTH's HOUSE, a player does not need an exact count on the spinner.

FAMILY RULES
When more advanced children or grown-ups join the the game, the regular rules are followed, except that in the first part of the game, all questions and answers are omitted when players pick up LETTERS, but the bonus move of 10 spaces is still given.

Wacky family word bowling game that features a unique wooden character dice ball that determines the amount and location of bowling pin tiles to flip over in attempt to spell words in each bowling frame to score big points. The ball comes in endless color combinations and features letter, numbers and symbols to challenge players word skills.

Player roll the dice, open indicated number of ball-tiles in indicated locations and try to form a word to score points.
After multiple rounds player adds up their points and the player with the most points is the winner.

Kid’s version of the original Telepathy game.

In this puzzle solving game of logic and deduction, players match wits to see who can be the first to locate their opponent’s secret square. Through the process of elimination, every turn brings you closer to finding its discovery. But watch out: your opponent may be closer to finding your secret square than you think!

Winner is the player who solves the opponent´s secret square.

name.value: Feroces vikigos: El juego de cartes
Vichinghi selvaggi: Il gioco della carta

item.description:
The Wild Vikings have been looting once again and return to the Viking village with their treasures. But horror of horrors! Nessie, the lake monster, suddenly appears in front of them and their ships gets into trouble sea. Will the Vikings manage to arrive at the village where the are safe and where they can divide up their precious loot?

Wild Vikings the card game is a simple bidding game with one round of bidding. A die dictates the turn of a player, either Nessie eats a ship, a bidding round starts with him, he gets the viking token, the player with the viking token draws a card or everybody draws a card.

There are 3 kinds of ships and 3 kinds of equipment cards to bid on the ships. Equipment cards can also be jokers for either color. Ships have values between 1 and 5.
The player who gains the most treasure wins the game.

Think you know how many Queen songs your friend can name? Is your throwing aim better than other people might think? In this game, you need to make or beat the best predictions to score points and win.

Players receive challenges and their opponents must guess how well they will perform. If the performing player beats the highest guess, they score points. However, if they fail to be the highest guess, the player who guesses closest steals their points!

Play as your favorite Kaiju from the popular Godzilla franchise in this classic style board game of dice rolling.

Roll the die and move your Kaiju around the game board fighting the other player's Kaiju. Use special abilities on your Kaiju's game card to perform range or melee attacks when in battles or defensive attacks against Kaiju.

Game objective; defeat the other player's Kaiju to win. Each player (in a standard game; 2 players) picks 4 Kaiju to play as. In a 3+ player game, players only choose 3 Kaiju.

Game features 12 Kaiju from Godzilla series;
-Anguirus
-Burning Godzilla
-King Ghidorah
-Godzilla
-Little Godzilla
-Mecha-Gigan
-Mecha-Godzilla
-Mothra
-Gigan
-Zilla
-Mothra Larva
-Rodan

link.value: Godzilla Rampage: Invasion of Gamera Supplement
Demonic Toys vs. Blood Dolls Game: Battle of the Tiny Terrors

item.description:
There is a battle waging for control of Centropolia, a city full of HEROES and VILLAINS. The mayor watches anxiously as 64 unique characters strategically attack, defend, and use special powers to claim victory. WHICH SIDE WILL YOU TAKE?

In this card game, you choose to defend the innocent or side with evil in a struggle that stretches to every corner of the city. The outcome depends on your ability to strategize against your opponent. There are several paths to victory, but only one side will win.

The objective is to attack your opponents and attain a specified number of Victory Points, which you earn each time a character survives a round. Players draw from a deck of attack cards and prepare strikes by playing three cards of the same attack type: brutal, elemental, science, or stealth. Players may also attempt to thwart enemy attacks with shield cards.

Engage in a back-and-forth style of attacks and take advantage of character strengths, weaknesses, and special powers. Use attack cards to prepare damaging strikes and eliminate your opponents before they eliminate you. There are thousands of possible HERO-VILLAIN combinations so that each match is fresh and competitive. The game rules are easy to learn, but the strategy you devise is limitless.

In essence a roll/spin and move game, advertised in the 1950s as "fun for all the family".

Game board, 2 dice, 4 pawns and 4 sets of coloured counters.

No image of the board is available but it is apparently a board with an outside track and an inner grid of "Roo" squares. According to the rules the object of the game is to monopolise as many 'Roo blocks' as possible by forming more 3-counter rows - horizontally, vertically or diagonally - than opponents. 10 points are scored each time a row of 3 is formed. A player rolls the dice to move around the track, and the track block on which he lands indicates the Roo block on which he is allowed to place one of his counters. When a particular Roo block means there is no chance for a player to start a row of 3 or block an opponent that block is considered dead and from then on no player moves to it. When all Roo blocks have been played out players compute their scores and highest score wins.

Publication details from The Game Catalog: US Games Through 1950, 8th edition, 1998. Rules from gamearchives.org.

Species is a game about ecology and evolution of plants for 2 or 3 players. Eight or nine different plant species compete for soil and sun, adapting to natural circumstances and to each other, while trying to survive a rampaging herd of grazing animals destroying everything in its path.

Players try to give the plant species under their control the right advantages to win the competition with the opponents’ species, and to spread as much as possible. Every turn, after the herd wipes out most of the plants from a small part of the map, the players secretly choose which of their species acquires a new adaptation (or loses one, or spawns onto the map), after which species spread and compete. These adaptations give advantages in specific parts of the map, or in combination with other advantages, or with other species with other advantages, or ...

Adaptations are grouped into seven kinds, giving a total of more than 140 thousand different combinations, ranging from poisonous swamp trees, to shade-loving herbs with berries, and many more. There are no dice or other randomization devices in the game (aside from starting order), but the interaction of species with various combinations of adaptations adds a level of complexity that can seem as unpredictable as a die roll.

item.description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese robotech animation "Aura Battler Dunbine". This game is one of the First Step series games for beginner.

Each unit represent one aura machine, include aura ship and aura battleship.

The turn sequence is simple, Repeat of movement and simultaneous attacking. The rule is only five pages, but some important elements is included. For example the aura power requirement level or difference of fire combat and close combat.

Victory condition is stated for each scenario.

Swedish quiz game (english: "how the hell did you know that?").

The questions are of a somewhat embarrasing nature - ranging from sex and gossip to drugs and crime - leaving participants wondering "how the hell" that person knew the answer.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

item.description:
Swedish quiz game. (english: "Finally, commercials!"

The questions are linked to different tv commercials, municipality slogans etc.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

Playing DRAW may remind you of Charades, but with drawing on paper instead of acting out the answers. In DRAW, though, both teams' (or even all three teams') clue givers may be drawing at the same time as players strive to be the first to guess the correct answer. When the answer is not designated "All Play," one team simply tries to come up with the answer before the timer runs out, which is usually but not always possible thanks to the varying difficulty levels of the answers. No great drawing talent is required; instead, players gain an edge if they have a good imagination when guessing, empathy for their team mates, and/or a general ability to communicate in restricted circumstances.

DRAW is a Swedish Pictionary like game, but only featuring strange and rude words.

Swedish quiz game. (English: "sport geek").

Simple quiz game with failry uncommon sports questions.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

A game in the "Activity" family of party games. Players have to act out, describe or draw words or phrases specified on a card, and the others have to guess the term. If the player's own team guesses the term, they get to move forward on the board. First team to reach the finish line wins the game.

This is an edition for children, and it stars "Franz Ferdinand", a boar from the "okidoki" children's TV program by Austrian broadcasting company ORF. Many of the terms that have to be guessed are directly related to the TV program.

The frogs have started a choir! In Octo – the translated French name of which is Octave and the Singing Frogs – you'll have to listen to their song, then sing the low, middle, or high notes.

How will you know which notes to take note of? The die will show which frog a player will have to follow. If a player guesses correctly, he takes a card; if he picks the wrong card, however, he has to return all the cards he has. As soon as a player uncovers three frogs in a row, that player receives a concert card. The first player to collect three concert cards wins!

item.description:
Swedish quiz game. (English: "Intimate").

Questions realting to sex, pornography, beauty, sex toys etc.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

Objective: score most hits
Table version of basketball. Players direct the metal ball on the play field in such way to score the goal (2 points). Players figures are placed on small springs.
If active player scores ball possession changes; if basketball hoop is missed player proceeds where ball ended. If ball ends outside other player proceeds. Game ends after aggreed time or result.

A party game that involves blindfolded drawing and guessing.

It is played in two teams. One player has to wear a blindfold so that he/she can't see what he/she is drawing. The other team members have to guess the words/phrases that are being drawn. There are easy tasks (a simple word, such as "house") and difficult ones (sometimes whole proverbs like "People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones."). Difficult tasks are worth more points than the easy ones. The team with the most points wins the game.

Components:
- 1 pencil
- 1 sand timer
- 1 notepad
- 1 blindfold
- 50 cards
- instructions

Trifecta Poker is based on a Trifecta of winning Horse Cards as Win, Place, and Show.

A blend of Horse Racing, Classic Poker games and all original Artwork.

This set of Race Horse Playing cards is a real game changer. For instance every card is a Face Card and there are no Kings or Queens, Jacks nor Aces. The Royalty here or the Ace of the Race is represented by what horse is the Winner of the Race. These cards wear Silks not Suits.

This is the only game that tells you the Winners before you Start. The only question is who holds the Winning hand. The objective of the Play is to determine if You hold a Winning hand and have a chance to take home the Cash. The Rules are Simple but you can't Win if you don't Try and it's obviously better if you Trifecta!

The rules are simple in the basic form of play however, all sorts of other cards games can be played with this new game.
Here are the rules:

The Rules
Trifecta Poker Hand Rankings

Trifecta Poker can be played using almost any variation of common Poker Play rules. The Key to Trifecta Poker is that the winning hand is based on a Trifecta of winning Horse Cards. 

Dealer shuffles the 52 Cards and draws 3 different Horse Cards in a vertical display outward from the POT known as the Trifecta Flop. After each play the cards are shuffled and a new Trifecta Flop is drawn. The First Horse drawn is the Winning Horse, the 2nd is the Place and the 3rd is the Show - aka WPS. or a Superfecta game a 4th Horse is drawn. Duplicate Horse cards if they appear in the Flop are returned to the deck. Dealer then re-shuffles the remaining deck and deals 5 cards to each player. Players may now hold pat their original cards or draw from one to four new cards from the deck. The Player with the highest combinations of Trifecta, Quinella, or WPS card combinations wins. A Trifecta is all three winning horses, a Quinella is the Win and Place horses, and the WPS are any horses in the money. WPS combinations are ranked by the highest number of Horse cards in the money without a Trifecta or Quinella.

All Trifecta Poker hand rankings can be improved by also holding typical Poker combinations as shown below:

 For instance no. 1 : A Trifecta with a pair of any horses beats a Trifecta with no pair.
 For instance no. 2: A Win horse with three of a kind beats a Win horse with a pair.
 If NO players hold WPS Cards typical Poker Hand rankings are won as follows:
 Four of a Kind - Four of the same Horse cards.
 Full House- Three of a kind and a pair. The player with the higher value three of a kind, wins in the event of a tie. If both players have the same three of a kind then the player with the highest pair wins.
 Straight -Five cards of any horses in ascending order with the higher straight wins the tie.
 Three of a Kind- Simply three cards of the same horse.
 Two Pairs of Horses - The player holding the highest pair takes the pot in the event that more than one player is holding two pairs. If two players are both holding the same two pair then the player with the highest fifth horse (i.e. the kicker) takes the pot.
 One Pair of Horses-Two cards of the same horse.
 HIGH Horse -Highest card takes all in the event there is a complete absence of the above hands.

Soccer simulation. The field is a grid of 6 x 5 boxes. Each player receives a pack of action cards. Either coach place the 11 pawn in the pitch.

The mechanism is simple: the player with possession of the ball takes three cards attack action and puts them into three boxes of your choice on the board, empty or occupied by pawns or their opponents. Two of the three cards played, however, are "cards bluff" and only serve to pull the wool over the eyes of the defender, who has two cards only line of defense to counter the effect of the cards of attack and must therefore try to guess where the attacker has the real paper and where the bluff. Place the cards, move the pieces closer to where they were put in the boxes of the tiles, the tiles are discovered and resolved effects. If the defender did not guess where the attacker has put the card real action, this explains its effects immediately. If you have guessed, it resolves the conflict according to a mechanism completely devoid of throwing dice (sic): the proceeds to count a series of penalties against both the defender the attacker (for example, for each opposing checker that is located on the trajectory of a passage the attacker receives a penalty). If you are under penalty wins the contrast. In case of a tie the defender wins. If the attacker loses the ball as time counter moves forward one minute.
The action cards allow it to attack steps, jumps, throws, crosses, headers and volleys.

The action cards allow defensive tackle and advances (ground ball or head).

Resolved shots: the attacker has a certain number of points distributed on a shot that has a football goal (drawn on a separate sheet) divided into six sections. The goalkeeper has 14 points that can be distributed parade of no more than five of the six sections. The choice is made for both in secret. If at least one section there are several points that shot points parade's goal. Otherwise, parade. In case of a tie, corner.

Who wins at the end of the two times (the duration of which may be agreed between the players) have scored more goals.

Players draw a category card and read the topic. Then they draw the letter-card instead of turning the wheel like in original Pim-Pam-Pet. Everyone is trying as quickly as possible to find a word that matches the subject and with that specific letter in start, in end or in middle of the word etc.

A good answer is rewarded by a chip in the color of the question. 
Who at the end of the game has scored the most points is the winner.

Each round in Tapple, one player draws a topic card, then starts the timer. In the next ten seconds, that player must give a single word answer that fits within the topic, press down the letter key in a special electronic device that corresponds to the first letter of that word, and restart the timer. The next player must then think of a word for the topic that starts with a different letter, press down that starting letter, and restart the timer. If a player runs out of time, she's out for the round. If only one player remains in a round, she collects the topic card. If players manage to press down all of the letters before knocking all but one player out of a round, the players reset the device, draw a new topic card, then start the timer again, this time having to give two answers for the topic – each starting with a different letter – within the allotted time. Whoever collects the most topic cards wins!

item.description:
Players place the picture board at the middle of the table.
In his turn player spins the spinner and if the arrow stops and points the letter all players look at the picture to search for something that starts with that letter.
First to points something and shouts it scores a point.

The ï¬rst player to reach the pre-agreed points wins the game!

Magical electronic board game where players have to help Ben and Holly using Holly’s magic and transform the animals back into their fairy and elf characters. Roll the dice and race around the board collecting the correct animal cards, if you land on a picnic basket space you can attempt one of Holly’s spells – the basket will either playa sound to transform the animals back or make a ‘bang’ which means the spell didn’t work.

If all the animals are transformed the player with the most animals transformed is the winner.

Peppa Pig Fairground Ride Game is fun and exciting 3D game of musical air-swings – but with a fun and exciting twist for young children.

The game begins when each player chooses their Peppa Pig character to play with, and places it on a seat on the fairground ride. The youngest player begins by pressing down on the red button top and everyone watches the air swings spin round and around and listening to the fun musical tune that will be playing. The aim of the game is to be the last player sat on the air swings – but if you Peppa Pig figurine lands next to a red ‘Hop Off’ space, then they must hop off the ride and try to guess where the empty seat will land next. Did you guess it right? If not, don’t worry, you have until the winner is left on the swings to hop back on the ride.

This food-themed trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players.
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about food and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The first player to reach the finish space on the board wins the game.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture Memo" and "Mashed Letters". "Picture Memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Mashed Letters" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: Players try and jump the Peppa Pig playing counters into the muddy puddle on the table in the middle of the game box and the first player to do this is the winner of the round. You can play as many rounds as you like, because after all, Peppa loves nothing more than jumping in the biggest and muddiest puddle she can find!

Peppa Pig loves playing in the rain and jumping in muddy puddles is one of her favourite games. Can you help Peppa jump in lots of muddy puddles on her way to school? Peppa Pig’s Muddy Puddle Game is designed for young children to have fun and enjoy a basic board game layout. Players use the Peppa playing figures to jump their way around the board and try to be the first in class - and win the game. The centre spinner adds fun and excitement - you’ll want to be the muddiest in class to win the game.

The game is for 2 to 4 players. There are some words on the game board – Start, Fiinsh and jump! -, but players do not have to be able to read to play. The game uses different coloured ‘squares’ to move around the board, and the spinner uses images to indicate where the players move to next, so this game can be enjoyed by your young Peppa Pig fan.

name.value: The Little Game of Good Manners

item.description:
This trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players. The topic is "good manners".

The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about good manners and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The game is over when the first player reaches the goal box. The player who has won the most cards/points is the winner.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture Memo" and "Confusing Letters". "Picture Memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Confusing Letters" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.

Shuffle the cards and place them face-down, in a circle around the Peppa Pig figurine. The youngest player begins by spinning Peppa as hard as he can. Wait until Peppa comes to a full stop. If she stops by your marker, listen carefully to what Peppa says (If Peppa stops in between two markers, she is talking to the person whose marker she has just passed.):

1. Peppa says “One!” - Turn over one of the cards. Call out the friend’s name. Is it your friend? then you get to keep the card. Is it one of the other player’s friend? Then show the card to the other players and put it back in the circle.
2. “Two!” You’re lucky! You may now look at two cards. Call out the friend’s name each time you turn over one of the cards. Is your friend on either of the cards? Then you get to keep that card. If it’s one of the other player’s friend, then show the card to the other players and put it back in the circle.
3. “Close your eyes!” Oh no! Now you have to give back one of your cards. Close your eyes while the other players hide it among the cards that are on the table. They must not tell you where they have put it!

The winner is the player who can collect all their friend picture cards first.

“Quirinalopoli. Rush for the Presidency” is a political version of a roll-and-move gamey styled like the Game of Goose enclosed to “Il Borghese” magazine in the summer 1997: it consisted of a board and the miniatures of eight Italian politicians of the day to be used as playing pieces. Players roll the dice and move their figures and respond to spaces on the board.


“Quirinalopoli” è un Gioco dell’Oca a tema politico allegato alla rivista “Il Borghese” nell’estate 1997: oltre alla plancia di gioco sono state realizzate anche le miniature di otto “protagonisti della Seconda Repubblica” da utilizzarsi come pedine.

Molecularama is a pattern-matching, set-collecting chemistry-themed card game similar to Gin Rummy and Ticket to Ride. Collect and swap element cards to build up molecules and score points.

The game comes with 24 different molecules and 75 element cards. Each player is trying to collect the correct elements to build them. Build six molecules to win the game but beware of attempting to build too many molecules, any unfinished molecules by the end of the game will penalise your score!

There are two modes of play to choose from; play with a secret selection of molecules in your hand where everyone is trying to guess what you're building, or play with a selection of molecule cards open on the table where two people could be racing to build the same thing.

Each molecule card comes with a witty joke or and interesting tid-bit. Remember, if you're not part of the solution, you're part of the precipitate.

name.value: Tr3cento. Una giornata nella Bolzano del 1300

item.description:
“Tr3cento. A day in Bolzano, 1300 A.D.” is a historically-themed didactic game made on the occasion of a gothic painters exhibition that took place in the Italian town of Bolzano in the year 2000.

The aim of the game is experiencing everyday’s life in the XIV century’s Bolzano.

Before starting, every player draws a card showing a different character and, by rolling a die and answering questions (each character has an own set), needs to make a whole round on the map in order to win the game.


“Tr3cento. Una giornata nella Bolzano del 1300” è un gioco didattico a tema storico realizzato per un’esposizione di pittori gotici allestita a Bolzano nel 2000.

Scopo del gioco è sperimentare la vita quotidiana nella Bolzano del Trecento.

All’inizio ogni giocatore pesca un personaggio da un mazzo di carte e - ora lanciando un dado, ora rispondendo a diverse domande (cambiano da personaggio a personaggio) - deve completare un giro della mappa per vincere.

name.value: Dead End: An Adventure Strategy Game. With Zombies.

item.description:
Dead End is survival-horror strategy game which pits survivors against zombies in a city-scape scenario. The world has succumbed to a laboratory-engineered super virus, bringing humanity to the brink of extinction and reanimated those who were once dead. The few who remain alive spend their days seeking out fellow survivors to help improve their chances for survival. It is a constant struggle to find sufficient food, tools, and--relatively safe--shelter.

Your story begins with your vehicle having just broken down in the middle of Sanctuary City. You must now wander the streets looking for replacement parts to repair your vehicle. During your trek, you will encounter roadblocks, lootable buildings, and countless zombie hordes. As you progress, your team will be faced with game-changing choices: does your team stop to rest and recuperate, risking the chance of a zombie attack, or move on? Do you split off from your group to check out that side-street, or stick together to better your survival odds? Meanwhile, the zombie player's hordes lurk around every corner, to ensure no one gets out alive.

Using a simplified dice-rolling system, Dead End allows for in-depth strategy and variety without bogging down the game in rules and exceptions. This allows the game to be fun and exciting for players of all ages.

Each player chooses a story. Shuffle the 32 cards and place them face down on the table. The oldest player begins the game by looking one of the cards. If the card is part of his story player takes it and puts it in his book of images. The player may continue his turn until he looks the card not belonging to his story. He shows the card to other and ends his turn. The first player who completed his picture with 8 cards is the winner.
remarks:
pretty same game approach like Memo Extra Picturebook Boys, but different box, materials & target group

Zombies, Elves, Robots, Pirates, Aliens, Ninjas & Gunslingers. Only one can be the best!

Each race has a unique victory condition that requires either getting their pawns to specific spots on the game board, or affecting the other players pawns a certain number of times. The races also each have unique powers that they can use each turn.

The players play cards from their hand to bring their pawn into play, move them about the board, and perform special actions, depending on their chosen race. The first player to complete their goal wins.

item.description:
Monopoly with a Bobcat construction equipment theme.

From the box: With Bobcat of Futureville, you too can live the life of a Bobcat dealer. Purchase Bobcat of Futureville and other dealerships for your chnace to lead the market. Achieve Brand Orange facility status and dig your way to Bobcat of Dealertown. Add another sales specialist and increase your market share and win money! But gamble wisely--if you land in the wrong neighborhood, you could be buying trucks and trailers from the dealer next door. Worse, if you don't take care of the customer, it'll cost you.

name.value: Shattered Peace: The War for Terra Nova Book 1

item.description:
"Three days have passed since Marabou, home of the Southern MILICIA, was obliterated by the CEF. Today, Earth forces descend on Terra Nova, blackening the skies, as thousands upon thousands of drop pods block the rays of Helios from reaching our planet.

People of Terra Nova, we stand on the precipice of destruction. They have come, uncaring, inhumane, and relentless. But they will be stopped.

For those who have died, for those who will die and those who will be opposed, we must fight back. We will prevail!"

- Field Commander Miranda Petite in an address to Black Talon Forces, TN 27 Summer 1950

The next few days will decide the fate of the planet, and although few know it, the fate of the galaxy and of humankind rests on Terra Nova.

This Full-Color, 54-page book is a campaign supplement for the Heavy Gear Blitz! Locked & Loaded Rulebook, and requires it as well as Black Talon: Return to Cat’s Eye for play. It also requires the use of six-sided dice and Dream Pod 9 Heavy Gear miniatures. For two or more players, ages 8 and up.

link.value: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Support Guide

item.description:
Translated box black blurb

School Order Rep has come to investigate any personal items student have brought to school. As a student, you must treat the Order rep correctly so as to avoid punishment.

How?

Well, by seeing to that your BL fanzines aren't "unnecessary" items, of course!

User summary
A simple card game consisting of different types of attractive boys, guys and men (anime style). Players take turns being the Order rep, who decides what preferences are OK, and the remaining players (students) try to play their cards so that they match them as much as possible. A game of deduction and creative guessing. And laughs.

The game also comes with identical rules called "Model Men", where the players try to guess what combination of model will sell the next fashion mag.

The aim of the game is to remove the traffic sign cards from the game board. The player who has gathered most cards is the winner.

Before starting to play, shuffle the 24 cards well and place them on the fields with the blue side upwards and with the poles of the sign posts pointing all in the same direction. No card should be placed on the field with the traffic lights. This field is used to place the pieces. Now agree on a player who starts, and then alternate clockwise. The player whose turn it is throws the dice and forwards his piece on the game board by the number of pips. After starting the game, the field with the traffic lights must not be entered again. You may move in all directions but not diagonally. During a move you may change the direction as often as you want. However, you have to keep two things in mind: you must not move on to a field twice during a move, and at the end of the move you must not arrive at the starting field. Bad luck, if you throw a six, because you will have to miss this turn. If a move ends on a field with a card, you have to guess which of the two signs shown on the blue side is displayed on the yellow side of the card. Subsequently look whether the traffic sign you think is shown on the yellow side. If the guess was correct, the player may take the card. The player places this card with the blue side upwards in front of himself. If the guess was wrong, the player has to return the card to the same place on the game board. If one card only is left on the game board, the player whose turn it is may throw the dice twice and move. If this card has been removed as well, every player counts his cards. The winner is who has most cards.

In the small town of Palermo a series of murders are disturbing the peaceful citizens. Mafia is everywhere and every night the number of victims grows higher. The citizens of Palermo try to discover the culprits. But who can they trust? Noone knows who may be behind the murders. One thing is certain though:

Everybody has a role to play in this story!

Palermo: The Big Cleanup is a new version of the well known party game (known mostly as Werewolf) in which the innocent citizens try to dig out the mafia members among them. What makes this game different from most of the other Werewolf versions out there is that ALL the innocent citizens have a hidden role with a special ability that will help them identify the criminals. Moreover, action cards handed to the players give them more options to gather information, bluff or discover identities!

But when you trust noone, how effectively can you use all that?

ΕπιπλÎ­ον, κÎ¬ρτες ενεργειÏŽν δÎ¯νουν νÎ­ες δυνατÏŒτητες για συλλογÎ® πληροφοριÏŽν, μπλÏŒφες και αποκαλÏψεις ενÏŒχων!

ÎŒταν ÏŒμως κανεÎ¯ς δε μπορεÎ¯ να επιστευτεÎ¯ κανÎ­ναν, πÏŒσο αποτελεσματικÎ¬ θα μπορÎ­σετε να αξιοποιÎ®σετε ÏŒλα αυτÎ¬;

item.description:
Crystal Clash is an easy-to-pick-up yet tremendously strategic card game for two players. One player picks the Light Deck and the other plays the Darkness Deck.

The goal of the game is to bring your opponent down to zero Crystals in their Crystal-Pool.

Each player starts with 10 Crystals (represented by 10-sided dice) and plays Characters, equips them with magical Relics and has them perform powerful Abilities. Your Crystals double as "Life Points" and resources.

At the beginning of your turn you draw 3 cards from your deck, then you may discard a card from your hand and add a number of Crystals to your Crystal-Pool equal to the Crystal Value of the discarded card (which doubles as cost to play the card from your hand). Then, in Main Phase, you may play Characters and Relics and have your Characters attack the opponent. Each unblocked attack results in 2 Crystals being removed from your opponent's Crystal Pool. If at any point a player has no more Crystals left in their Pool, they lose the game immediately.

Crystal Clash consists of two preconstructed, well balanced decks with 40 UNIQUE cards each. All the cards are illustrated in Anime-Style by Manchen Yang (the Darkness Deck) and Laurie Thomas (the Light Deck).


This game is a cooperative effort by Andreas Propst and Nora Propst, Andreas' younger sister.

If you want to take a look at all 40 different Darkness Cards please visit

http://ap.o-nan.org/2012/11/crystal-clash-darkness-deck-all-cards/

If you want to take a look at all 40 different Light Cards please visit

http://ap.o-nan.org/2012/11/crystal-clash-light-deck-all-cards/

item.description:
Children's game that is very much in the camp of a favourite German game called Malefiz ('Barricade in English').

Each player gets two identical playing pieces. The board features paths from the bottom up to Pride Rock at the top. But the paths get closer together as they go up the board which results in playing pieces getting a little tight to move. Thus, if you land exactly on another playing piece, that piece must return to the bottom row and start again.

Movement is by a die (that includes a spot symbol on two faces). Should you roll a spot you can place a jungle maker on to the board. Or, you can move one on the board to a new location. These jungle markers are blockers which cannot be jumped.

The winner is the first player to get one of his pieces on to the Pride Rock square by an exact throw of the die.

After years of taking advantage of hotel guests and tenants, Wealthy Uncle Moneybag's financial empire has crumbled into foreclosure. The millionaire's lavish property must be sold off to satisfy his debts, and you are one of the creditors! You may not need a diamond-encrusted watch or a rare fossil collection, but with 2-6 creditors sniffing around, maybe you should just take all that you can grab?!

Playing a round of Foreclosed! is simple, but the strategies are endless. Each turn, you'll be awarded a single item from Wealthy Uncle Moneybag's outrageous collection. If you receive some expensive silverware which you're not interested in collecting, and another player has received the fancy automobile you had your eye on, just make that player an offer.

If the other player wants to keep their item, they'll be forced to "protect" it by paying more money than you offered them. If a player does not have enough money, or does not want to spend the money they have, they must accept your offer. Once all players have had a chance to make offers, the round ends and all acquired items are added to their new owner's collection. Sometimes you will find it is just as rewarding to force other players to spend their money protecting items you didn't really want in the first place!

Foreclosed! lasts thirty minutes and can be played by 2-6 players.

For added depth and challenge to the game, Foreclosed! includes action cards for experienced players.

•••

Vasaran Alla - peli ahneille neuvottelijoille.

Hyvin suosittu ja rikas filmitähti on tehnyt yllättäen henkilökohtaisen vararikon! Koko omaisuus on menossa pankeille ja muille velkojille. Sinä olet yksi velkojista ja olet menossa velkojien kokoukseen neuvottelemaan omaisuuden jaosta. Vastassasi on muita ahneita velkojia, jotka eivät tunne sääliä kun on kyse kullasta, kiinteistöistä ja antiikkiesineistä.

Tehtävänäsi on haalia itsellesi mahdollisimman arvokkaat omaisuudet ja arvoesineet. Filmitähden omaisuus on jaettu 5 ryhmään; kiinteistöihin, autoihin, arvoesineisiin, antiikkiin ja sekalaiseen ylellisyysomaisuuteen. Lisäksi jaossa on riihikuivaa rahaa. Pesänhoitaja jakaa omaisuutta velkojille määrällisesti tasaisesti, mutta laadussa voi olla eroja. Omaisuutta jaettaessa voit suorittaa vaihtoja muiden velkojien kanssa, tai suojautua muiden vaatimuksilta lakimiehesi (=rahan) avulla. Mitä enemmän saman sarjan arvotavaraa ja -omaisuutta keräät, sitä tuottoisamman kokonaisuuden saat. Istu pöytään, omaisuuden jako alkaa!

The board game, Moneture, illustrates operation of the National Bank of Serbia under inflation targeting regime. Players take the role of the Governor and apply appropriate measures to influence the actual situation, win or lose the number of points and maintain inflation within the target range. The points to be won in the game represent success features: inflation value, dinar value and public trust. In addition, for membership in the EU monetary system, three conditions have to be met (Price Stability, Financial Stability and Independence of the National Bank). The winner of the game is the player who first completes all the specified tasks and reaches the end of the inner circle of the board - average inflation of the European Union.

name.value: The Amazing Adventures of Fibber McGee

item.description:
"A hilarious party game for any number of players. A riot of fun for everyone - take it from me! - Fibber McGee

...by Arrangement with the National Broadcasting Co. Inc."

A large deck of yellow cards are placed face down on a table in a loose spread out pile. Each card has a few words that make up a partial sentence on them.

One player reads a story out of a booklet and when the reader encounters a blank line ("_______") in the story, they pause and another player quickly draws a card and reads what is on it, then the reader continues.

For example, "My first encounter came after a series of lessons from _A_perforated_fire_hose_ who had slain nine thousand bulls."

Some cards have points on them, so the player who drew that cards would get some points. When all cards have been drawn, the points are tallied and a winner determined.

In the abstract strategy game Rondo, players try to score as many points as possible by placing tokens on numbered spaces on the game board, with the board consisting of two concentric rings of numbered spaces and multiple spokes connecting these rings and the center of the board. (The game board is double-sided, with different values on each side.) The numbers come in five colors, and players start the game by drawing two tokens (also in five colors) from a bag and placing them on a rack, thereby hiding the color of the tokens from other players.

On a turn, a player can either (1) play as many tokens as he wants in a continuous chain, with the first token being placed next to an occupied space or the center space, then drawing one token from the bag or (2) drawing two tokens and placing none on the board. A player can hold at most five tokens on his rack.

When a player places tokens, the color of the token must match the space being covered; he immediately scores the points shown on this space. A player can choose to place a non-matching token face down on a space in order to reach another space, but he scores no points for the face-down token. Alternatively, a player can play multiple tokens of the same color on a matching space and score the listed number of points for each token placed.

The game board has a number of dark grey spaces on it. The game ends at the end of the round in which all of these spaces are occupied or a player cannot draw enough tokens to complete his turn. The player with the most points wins!

item.description:
Dog Royal plays like its predecessor DOG in that the object of the game is for a player (or team) to move his (their) tokens from home to the target area as quickly as possible. Tokens are moved in a clockwise direction along the track on the game board according to the value on the cards played. The first player or team to move all of its tokens to the target area first wins.

What distinguishes Dog Royal from Dog are two twists: First, Dog Royal includes a number of special cards not present in the previous game. You can move 1-7 spaces, switch the location of two tokens, draw one token to another like a magnet, equal the value of the card previously played, and more.

Second, each of the four tokens controlled by a player bears a symbol – king, knight, citizen, jester – and each such token has a special power. The king, for example, cannot move more than seven spaces on a turn, so all cards with a higher value cannot be used to move the king, but the king cannot be bumped off the track by any token other than another king. (Players can choose to keep the symbols face-down and treat all tokens the same, if desired.)

item.description:
A push your luck dice rolling game.

Object: "All players try to accumulate the highest number of points per turn, which uhen added to their score, gives them the necessary 10,000 points to win."

Equipment: box, instructions, scoresheets, dice cup and six dice (marked blank, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5).

Scoring: blank = 50, 1=100, 3 of a kind = varies (2-5 = die x 100, blank = 500, 1 = 1000), straight (blank, 1-5) = 1000, and 6 of a kind = 3 of a kind x 3.

A turn-based roll-and-move car racing game based on the zany videogame kart racing mania (Mario Kart, Crash Team Racing, etc.) Each player tries to be first to cross the finish line, but not before equipping weapons cards or playing sneaky tricks and trying to blow the competition out of their way!

The core mechanic of this game is a trade-off between going fast and equipping weapons (which reduces the speed and sturdiness of your vehicle.) Eventually, a player's car will be destroyed, at which point the player will return to the nearest checkpoint and continue racing (or just blowing up their enemies for the fun of it!)

name.value: Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ: Side One

item.description:
Tactical land combat game based on Japanese robotech animation series Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ. The game is also covering combat in the space colony.

Each unit represent one humanoid weapons called mobile suits(MS). Unit ability is writen on the separate data cards.

Each player control one or few MS and aims at the destruction of the opponent MS.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclose and resolve at simultaneous.

name.value: Mobile Suit Z Gundam: Sign of Z

item.description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese robotech animation series Mobile Suit Z Gundam. This game covering all battle field and weapons in story.

Each unit represent a mobile suit (giant robot). Unit ability is written on each unit.

The turn sequence is simple, repeat of movement and simultaneous attacking. Some special weapons covered by special rules, such as Mega Bazooka Launcher or Funnel.

Victory condition is stated for each scenario.

name.value: Love Letter: Kanai Factory Limited Edition
Love Letter: Legend of the Five Rings
Morgen kommt der Weihnachtsmann: Mein Wunschzettel

item.description:
All of the eligible young men (and many of the not-so-young) seek to woo the princess of Tempest. Unfortunately, she has locked herself in the palace, and you must rely on others to take your romantic letters to her. Will yours reach her first?

Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. Your goal is to get your love letter into Princess Annette's hands while deflecting the letters from competing suitors. From a deck with only sixteen cards, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, trying to expose others and knock them from the game. Powerful cards lead to early gains, but make you a target. Rely on weaker cards for too long, however, and your letter may be tossed in the fire!

Number 4 in the Tempest: Shared World Game Series

link.value: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
Harap Alb Continuă... un joc Love Letter
Love Letter: The Hobbit – The Battle of the Five Armies

item.description:
Irezumi is a game in which players play the role of the Yakuza's leaders identified with unique different tattoos (secret card). The players manage their deck of Tattoo and Inks to complete the Irezumi of the subordinates's body in order to obtain their loyalty.

Your goal is to obtain the majority playing cards in different stack. All the choices are focused on the bluff and the deduction of which tattoo belongs to a certain boss. There are different strategies to manage your hand and the luck factor, although present, is very limited.

Tactical space combat game based on Japanese robotech animation series "Blue Comet SPT Layzner".

Each unit represent a SPT(Super Powered Tracer, robotech name in this universe). Unit ability is written on the data cards.

Each player control one or few SPT and aims at the destruction of the opponent SPT.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclose and resolve at simultaneous. The law of the inertia acts on the movement in the outer space. Feature of this game is a rule of search operation using the dual map.

Tactical land combat game based on Japanese robotech animation series "Blue Comet SPT Layzner". The second game for Layzner.

Each unit represent a SPT(Super Powered Tracer, robotech name in this universe). Unit ability is written on the data cards.

Each player control one or few SPT and aims at the destruction of the opponent SPT.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclose and resolve at simultaneous. Feature of this game is a rule of V-Max system, add a six to eight times faster and immune to ranged weapons.

From the objective in the rule book: "The object of the game is to depart from home, arrive at the hunting camp, go on a gobbler hunt and be the first to "Bag" your gobbler." Players roll a die to move along the paths in the woods. Spaces include such activities as "Gas Stop", "Forgot Flashlight", and "Stuck in Swamp", all of which result in losing a turn. There are also 3 decks of cards: Road Chance, Hunt Chance, and Phone Chance. Also from the rule book, to win the game, "A player must roll the EXACT NUMBER ON THE DIE to get his gobbler or be lucky enough to draw the 'WINNER CARD' from the green chance pile."

Monster Match is a fast and fun card game where you are trying to reassemble body parts from different monsters. The game suits between 2 to 7 players, for ages 8 and up.

The game consists of one deck that contains all the monster parts. Players are dealt out cards and take turn trying to improve upon there monster(s).

Taking its mechanical roots in games like gin rummy but with a new theme and abilities for cards makes this anything but what your grandmother use to play.

name.value: Das kleine Ich bin ich: Würfelpuzzle

item.description:
Objective: be the first completing your puzzle
 - acting by turns -
arrange puzzle tile by colour and build a pile for each player,
symbols on top.
Each player rolls the die:
There is a matching symbol on top of your pile - take it and try to complete your puzzle; if your die shows 'Das kleine Ich bin Ich = joker', take the tile, too, but the 'moon' symbol let you sleep - lose one turn.

A game for foreign learners of the English language.

The game contains more than 1.000 questions in 5 different levels, from beginner to advanced. There are also 5 different categories: vocabulary, grammar, phrases, general knowledge, and miscellaneous.

A die determines which category a question is asked from. It shows five colours or a star (let's the player decide if he/she wants a grammar or vocabulary question). If the player answers the question correctly, he/she wins the card. Cards are collected until one player is ready for the grand finale: The player who is first to answer correctly here wins the game.

The game can also be played in teams.

Grow is a solitaire game where the player guides a growing forest towards safety from the lumber industry.

The Player builds his/her tree through a series of rounds using hex tiles representing branches and leaves. The leaf tiles provides energy (used as Action point) for the player to spend growing his tree further or expanding his tree population.

As the player's tree grows bigger, it also becomes more profitable to cut down. The lumberjack token will become more active and more powerful as the game progresses. The player loses the game when there's no more trees for the lumberjack to cut down!

The game is a free Print-and-play game available to anyone! Counters are provided but standard wooden cube are suggested for convenience.

Introduction

It is said that the mythical King Tuu Ku Ihu and the god Make Make possessed the “mana” or divine power to command the Moai to walk.

Question is, have you got the mana to move them!

Moai is a territorial game for 2 players.

The game is played on a standard 8x8 board with the four corners removed or blanked out.You will need a Black and a White pawn and a supply of counters.

Moai can also be played on a hexagonal board with 91 hexagonal cells and the same rules apply.

Goal

Push or Pull your opponent's pawn (Moai) until the last player able to place a counter and move his own Moai wins.

Play

Players begin by placing their Moai on an empty space anywhere on the board.

White moves first.

Players take turns.

A player on his turn makes 2 moves.
 1) Place a counter on a space inline (orthogonally or diagonally) with you or your opponent’s Moai on the board.

Once placed counters are fixed.

2) You push or pull you or your opponent’s Moai (orthogonally or diagonally) towards or away from the counter you just placed along an empty path or a player can also move a Moai orthogonally (orthogonally or diagonally on a hex board) towards or away from the counter just placed along an empty path ending with a single space diagonal turn left or right.

A Moai must move a minimum of 1 space toward or away from the counter just placed.

Play continues until the player that is still able to place a counter and move his own Moai wins.

The HomeVesting playing board has two six-sided playing courses: the outer, purple “Rehabilitation” course, and the inner, orange “Selling” course. Each course represents a different stage of the investing process.

The outer “Rehabilitation” course is where we initially buy, carry, and fix up our properties. The game always starts on this outer course.

The inner “Selling” course is where we seek deals to sell our investments and cash out. Players individually move onto the inner Selling path as they complete their Rehabilitation process.

Summary of the Game

Players select investment properties, begin on their individual colored Start spot, and take turns moving their pawn around the outer Rehabilitation path to develop their properties.

Eventually, each player will complete their Rehabilitation phase, progress to their colored Start spot on the inner Selling course, then proceed around the Selling course to seek a deal for cashing out and selling their investments.

Play continues until only one player remains which has not settled all debts and cashed out of the game. All players have the option of short-selling and cashing out of the game at any time before completing their full rehabilitation and selling process, which establishes their final cash position. But a final remaining player is always forced into a short-sell to end the game. All players then evaluate their final cash position. The player finishing with the most money wins.

Top-A-Top Plus is a simple and fast-playing party game in which players take turns placing their cards in the middle of the table and reacting appropriately to the funny pictures on the cards played, e.g., by making special gestures or saying something.

Your reflexes and the ability to make associations are crucial. Your reaction has to be quick and appropriate or else you lose a turn and take all the cards on the table into your pile. The first player to get rid of all of his cards wins.

Top-A-Top Plus is both a standalone game and an expansion for the Spiel 2011 release Top-A-Top, which was game of the year in Romania in the category of children's games.

Integrates with:

 Top-A-Top

UNRELEASED GAME

 
 
 Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.

 


Chez Guild blends the characters from the web series The Guild with the Chez Geek series of card games, with characters trying to collect slack while annoying their roommates and keeping them from achieving their goals.

Game by S. Zdorovtsov depicts Napoleon's invasion of Russia on a strategic level. Players command Corps and their goal is to destroy their opponent. This could be done by reducing enemy to 3 or below Corps. French start with 14 Corps and the Russians with 13, but one French Corps leaves play on Turn 9, to simulate Reynier's help to the Austrians. Game mechanic also includes reinforcements, partisans, morale, and generals.
